text:
Remember when Speaker ruled that MV3 would have to be different to MV2 for it to be allowed a Commons vote?

Number 10 line today is that the Strasbourg concessions agreed a fortnight ago were yesterday *approved* by the European Council and that amounts to a substantial change.

things Jeremy Corbyn isn't ruling out, one week from Brexit day:

- revoking Article 50.
- general election
- second referendum
- customs union
- Common Market 2.0

a new lowlight in today's @Jack_Blanchard_ email

"A source working late in parliament last night emailed Playbook to say the toilets in Portcullis House had stopped flushing, and the smell was getting grimmer by the minute. 'The place really is backing up with sh*t,' they said."
author: PickardJE

text:
from @JGForsyth in the Spectator, out now: 

"Not since Denis Healey was forced to ask the International Monetary Fund for an emergency loan in 1976 has this country been so humiliated. Then the nation required an economic bailout. This time it needs a political one."
author: PickardJE

"She's looking for ways to bounce people into her deal."

text:
here's part of the *rather pointed* statement just released by the four party leaders:

"We welcome the opportunity to sit down together with Jeremy Corbyn for the first time tomorrow. The UK faces an unprecedented crisis with Brexit, and Westminster remains deeply divided."
author: PickardJE

text:
Leaders of Lib Dems, Greens, Plaid, SNP were meant to meet  Corbyn this afternoon. He didn't turn up. 

Maybe due to Bercow bombshell but attendees unimpressed. "Not sure it shows his willingness to work cross-party," says one attendee. 

New meeting fixed for tomorrow.
author: PickardJE

text:
Here’s the conclusion:

Speaker warns the government that it can only come back with another meaningful vote on Brexit if it is “not the same nor substantially the same” as the one torpedoed by 149 votes last week.....
author: PickardJE

text:
Bercow now citing Erskine May to pole-axe Theresa May by questioning whether she can bring back the “meaningful vote” again if unchanged: 

“It’s a necessary rule to ensure the sensible use of the House’s time.”

Lots of chuntering now as he builds up to a big announcement.....
author: PickardJE
